content.description: Starting basically in front of the giant dead Hemlock tree (slightly to climbers left of the base of the tree) look up for the large, deep jug hole at about 12ft up. Bagin standing below that. Head up to the jug hole, then past that to the higher, horizontal jug crack. Continue to the top spine. Either downclimb the spine, down climb the slab you just sent, or downclimb "Clear & Present Danger".
content.location: In front of the close Hemlock.

content.description: About as good as easy slab climbing gets. 20 feet of fun. Just remember that the easiest way back down is probably this same line.Start 5ft right of the Big Tree Arete (10ft left of Hemlock Slab) with your right hand on the right facing triangle point crimp, and a left hand on a divot. Head up to to staggered thin pockets, then past a crimp to the very long crack rail, another rail, and the two massive lobes. Mantle on the lobes and stand to the jug crack. You can go all the way to the pointed top, or stand on the flat tot he left to climb back down afterward.
content.location: On the tall back (uphill facing) side of the boulder. this line is on the left-most side of the face.

content.description: This is the big free standing boulder beside the long row of boulders. Hemlock is a pyramid-like boulder with tall slabs an awesome steep face and enticing aretes.Note: This boulder has no walk off. You will need to acquaint yourself with the easiest slab line, or work down the long spine of the boulder, both of which are beta intensive. Climb these features before anything else here as to avoid becoming stranded.
